:: RHS :: RHS Student Wins Writing Award Honors

Congratulations to RHS sophomore Dana Serea! Dana won a Scholastic Gold Key Writing Award for flash fiction for her piece entitled “Beautiful Like Us” and an Honorable Mention for poetry for her piece “Moon Phases” in the New Jersey Scholastic Art & Writing Awards competition.

This is a national competition that runs in local communities around the nation. In 2019, students submitted nearly 340,000 works of art and writing to the Scholastic Awards. It truly is an honor to be distinguished from hundreds of thousands of entries.

Please click here to read Dana’s award winning work: Moon Phases.

Dana’s piece “Beautiful Like Us” will also move on to the final level of the awards for potential selection for national recognition.

December Word from the Principal

It is hard to believe that we are in December already! It has been a very exciting time here at RHS with a successful fall season. The members of our National Honor Society competed in the annual Rutherford vs. Becton spelling bee on the day before Thanksgiving. Rutherford once again defeated Becton to start the holiday weekend off on a high note. Our band and choir students have been working extremely hard preparing for their Winter Concert, which will take place at 7:30 PM on December 12. December 20 will be a half-day and RHS will be having a holiday music assembly. We will return from our winter break on January 2. I wish all a safe and joyful holiday season and a happy new year.

:: K CENTER :: Trimester 2

It is hard to believe that the first trimester at the Kindergarten Center has come to an end. It is amazing to see the growth in each student since their very first day. Students have made new friends, explored various art mediums, created and repeated musical beats, explored new languages, and engaged in numerous team building activities.

The second trimester is just as exciting as students begin to apply many of the foundational skills in new ways. Writers are transitioning from labeling drawings to writing across pages, readers are applying letter/sound associations to decode new words and mathematicians are demonstrating number sense through 100.

This has already been such an exciting time of new opportunities and growth and we look forward to all that is to come.
